        Î³I: (float): importance factor

    Returns:

                Î³I=1.20)
print(f'Î±g = {Î±g}g')

SeÂ¶

In [12]:

print(spectra.Se.__doc__)



    Args:
        T (float): The vibration period of a linear single-degree-of-freedom system
        Î±g (float): The design ground acceleration on type A ground (ag = Î³I*agR)
        S (float): The soil factor
        TB (float): The lower limit of the period of the constant spectral acceleration branch
        TC (float): The upper limit of the period of the constant spectral acceleration branch
        TD (float): The value defining the beginning of the constant displacement response range of the spectrum
        Î· (float): The damping correction factor with a reference value of Î· = 1 for 5% viscous damping

    Returns:
        float: The elastic acceleration response spectrum. Given using the expressions:

        .. math::
            :nowrap:

            \begin{eqnarray}
                0 \le T \le T_B \rightarrow & S_e(T) & = Î±_g\cdot S \cdot (1+\dfrac{T}{T_B}\cdot(Î·\cdot 2.5 -1)) \\
                T_B \le T \le T_C \rightarrow & S_e(T) & = Î±_g\cdot S \cdot Î·\cdot 2.5 \\
                T_C \le T \le T_D \rightarrow & S_e(T) & = Î±_g\cdot S \cdot Î·\cdot 2.5\cdot \dfrac{T_C}{T} \\
                T_D \le T \le 4s \rightarrow & S_e(T) & = Î±_g\cdot S \cdot Î·\cdot 2.5\cdot \dfrac{T_C\cdot T_D}{T^2}
            \end{eqnarray}



In [13]:

Se = spectra.Se(T=0.50,
               Î±g = 0.24,
               S=1.20,
               TB=0.15,
               TC=0.50,
               TD=2.0,
               Î·=1.0)
print(f'Se = {Se}g')

Se = 0.72g

SDeÂ¶

print(spectra.SDe.__doc__)



    Args:
        T (float): The vibration period of a linear single-degree-of-freedom system
        Se (float):The elastic acceleration response spectrum

    Returns:
        float: The elastic displacement response spectrum. Given using the expression:

        .. math::
            S_{De}=S_e(T)\cdot(\dfrac{T}{2Ï})^2



In [15]:

Sde = spectra.SDe(T=0.5,
                 Se=0.72*9.81)
print(f'Sde = {Sde:.3f}m')

Sde = 0.045m

dgÂ¶

In [16]:

print(spectra.dg.__doc__)



    Args:
        Î±g (float): The design ground acceleration on type A ground (ag = Î³I*agR)
        S (float): The soil factor
        TC (float): The upper limit of the period of the constant spectral acceleration branch
        TD (float): The value defining the beginning of the constant displacement response range of the spectrum

    Returns:
        float: Design ground displacement. Given using the expression:

         .. math::
            d_{g}=0.025\cdot Î±_g \cdot S \cdot T_C  \cdot T_D



In [17]:

dg = spectra.dg(Î±g=0.24,
               S=1.20,
               TC=0.50,
               TD=2.0)
print(f'dg = {dg:.4f}g')

dg = 0.0072g

SdÂ¶

In [18]:

print(spectra.Sd.__doc__)



    Args:
        T (float): The vibration period of a linear single-degree-of-freedom system
        Î±g (float): The design ground acceleration on type A ground (ag = Î³I*agR)
        S (float): The soil factor
        TB (float): The lower limit of the period of the constant spectral acceleration branch
        TC (float): The upper limit of the period of the constant spectral acceleration branch
        TD (float): The value defining the beginning of the constant displacement response range of the spectrum
        q (float): The behaviour factor
        Î² (float): The lower bound factor for the horizontal design spectrum. Recommended value for Î² is 0.2

    Returns:
        float: Design spectrum for elastic analysis. Given using the expressions:

        .. math::
            :nowrap:

            \begin{eqnarray}
                0 \le T \le T_B \rightarrow & S_d(T) & = Î±_g\cdot S \cdot (\dfrac{2}{3}+\dfrac{T}{T_B}\cdot(\dfrac{2.5}{q} - \dfrac{2}{3})) \\
                T_B \le T \le T_C \rightarrow & S_d(T) & = Î±_g\cdot S \cdot \dfrac{2.5}{q} \\
                T_C \le T \le T_D \rightarrow & S_d(T) & = Î±_g\cdot S \cdot \dfrac{2.5}{q} \cdot \dfrac{T_C}{T} \ge Î² \cdot Î±_g \\
                T_D \le T \le 4s \rightarrow & S_d(T) & = Î±_g\cdot S \cdot \dfrac{2.5}{q} \cdot \dfrac{T_C\cdot T_D}{T^2} \ge Î² \cdot Î±_g
            \end{eqnarray}



In [19]:

Sd = spectra.Sd(T=0.50,
               Î±g = 0.24,
               S=1.20,
               TB=0.15,
               TC=0.50,
               TD=2.0,
               q=3.9,
               Î²=0.20)
print(f'Sd = {Sd:.3f}g')

Sd = 0.185g

Î·Â¶

In [20]:

print(spectra.Î·.__doc__)



    Args:
        Î¾ (float): the viscous damping ratio of the structure[%]

    Returns:
        float: The value of the damping correction factor. Given using the expressions:

        .. math::
            Î· = \sqrt{\dfrac{10}{5+Î¾}} \ge 0.55


In [26]:

Î·_5 = spectra.Î·(5)
print(f'Î·(5%) = {Î·_5:.2f}')

Î·_7 = spectra.Î·(7)
print(f'Î·(7%) = {Î·_7:.2f}')

Î·(5%) = 1.00
Î·(7%) = 0.91
